alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 8:32PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Benton, Delaware, southeastern Mayes, northwestern Adair and northern Cherokee Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 832 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Peggs, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Bella Vista... Siloam Springs... Jay... Gentry... Gravette... Decatur... Locust Grove... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Highfill... Oaks... Springtown... Northwest Arkansas Regional Air... Peggs... Rose... Leach... Scraper... Twin Oaks... Maysville... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Arkansas.
